What is the Ruby code to add a last sentence to the quote "The best way to predict the future is to create it" in Markdown format?
```ruby
quote = "The best way to predict the future is to create it"
new_quote = "#{quote} And if you can't create it, at least try to shape it positively."
puts new_quote
```
How would you modify the Ruby code to add your desired last sentence to the quote in a Markdown format?

To modify the Ruby code so that it adds a last sentence to the quote and formats it in Markdown, you can wrap the quote in Markdown syntax. For example, using emphasis or blockquotes is common in Markdown. Here's how you can modify the code:

```ruby
quote = "The best way to predict the future is to create it"
last_sentence = "And if you can't create it, at least try to shape it positively."

# Combine the quotes and format it in Markdown as a blockquote
new_quote = "> #{quote} #{last_sentence}"

puts new_quote
```

This code wraps the entire quote, including the additional sentence, in a Markdown blockquote by adding a `>` at the beginning. You can also choose to use emphasis or other Markdown features as needed.
